#summary Custom and Default 'make' directive documentation

= Defaults =

By default, simply running 'make' from the src/ directory will build er9x.hex in the configuration currently in use by the developer. As at revision 6, this is equivalent to ...

<blockquote><pre>make EXT=FRSKY KEYRPT=DELAY BEEPER=SPEAKER</pre></blockquote>

The Makefile also default to the 'usbtiny' AVR programmer type.

= Available Build Directives =

<ul>
<li>EXT=

Values: STD, FRSKY (default), JETI

</li>
<li>KEYRPT=

Values: STD, DELAY (default)

</li>
<li>BEEPER=

Values: BUZZER, SPEAKER (default)

</li>
</ul>

== Standard ER9X make commands ==

All other stand ER9X make commands remain present. Examples include ...

<blockquote><pre>*make* - builds er9x.hex with the default configuration

*make wflash* [[PROGRAMMER=usbtiny]] - programs/flashes the 9X using er9x.hex and optional programmer type override

*make reeprom* [[TARGET=models]] - reads the 9X eeprom (model/settings) data into er9x.bin with optional target override

*make weeprom* [[TARGET=models]] - writes er9x.bin to the 9X eeprom with optional target (source) override

etc</pre></blockquote>
